newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austrian police storm jail, free hostages unhurt.
newsitem.headline: Austrian police storm jail, free hostages unhurt.

text.p: Austrian special police forces stormed a jail in the southern Austrian town of Graz on Thursday night and freed three hostages being held by three convicts, Austrian television said.
A 30-man commando rescued the hostages in an assault that lasted two minutes, it added. The hostages were said to be unharmed but in shock after 10 hours in captivity.
The three prisoners, including Palestinian Tawfik ben Ahmed Chaovali, convicted for a 1985 bomb attack at Vienna airport, were now back behind bars.

The incident began on Thursday morning when the prisoners seized three prison staff, demanding eight million schillings ($755,400) in ransom and a getaway helicopter, and threatened to kill the hostages unless their demands were met. ($1=10.59 Schilling)
